CPSC340.title: CPSC 340 Machine Learning and Data Mining
CPSC340.info: Models of algorithms for dimensionality reduction, nonlinear regression, classification, clustering and unsupervised learning; applications to computer graphics, computer games, bio-informatics, information retrieval, e-commerce, databases, computer vision and artificial intelligence.

MATH152.title: MATH 152 Linear Systems
MATH152.info: 2D and 3D geometry, vectors and matrices, eigenvalues and vibration, physical applications. Laboratories demonstrate computer solutions of large systems. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH200.title: MATH 200 Calculus III
MATH200.info: Analytic geometry in 2 and 3 dimensions, partial and directional derivatives, chain rule, maxima and minima, second derivative test, Lagrange multipliers, multiple integrals with applications. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH220.title: MATH 220 Mathematical Proof
MATH220.info: Sets and functions; induction; cardinality; properties of the real numbers; sequences, series, and limits. Logic, structure, style, and clarity of proofs emphasized throughout.

STAT200.title: STAT 200 Elementary Statistics for Applications
STAT200.info: Classical, nonparametric, and robust inferences about means, variances, and analysis of variance, using computers. Emphasis on problem formulation, assumptions, and interpretation. See the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion Lists: www.calendar.ubc.ca/vancouver/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

EECE320.title: EECE 320 Discrete Structures and Algorithms
EECE320.info: Discrete structures, such as trees and graphs, and their properties; introduction to algorithms and algorithmic complexity. Proof of correctness; design techniques such as greedy algorithms and dynamic programming. Credit will be granted for only one of EECE 320 or CPSC 320.

CPSC260.title: CPSC 260 Data Structures and Algorithms for Computer Engineers
CPSC260.info: Design and analysis of object-oriented programs, emphasizing data structures. Topics include: classes, interfaces, fundamental data structures, algorithmic complexity, basic debugging and testing techniques.

MATH221.title: MATH 221 Matrix Algebra
MATH221.info: Systems of linear equations, operations on matrices, determinants, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, diagonalization of symmetric matrices. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

APSC160.title: APSC 160 Introduction to Computation in Engineering Design
APSC160.info: Analysis and simulation, laboratory data acquisition and processing, measurement interfaces, engineering tools, computer systems organization, programming languages. Credit will only be given for one of: APSC 160, CPSC 301, or EOSC 211.

CPSC210.title: CPSC 210 Software Construction
CPSC210.info: Design, development, and analysis of robust software components. Topics such as software design, computational models, data structures, debugging, and testing.

CPSC221.title: CPSC 221 Basic Algorithms and Data Structures
CPSC221.info: Design and analysis of basic algorithms and data structures; algorithm analysis methods, searching and sorting algorithms, basic data structures, graphs and concurrency.

MATH217.title: MATH 217 Multivariable and Vector Calculus
MATH217.info: Partial differentiation, extreme values, multiple integration, vector fields, line and surface integrals, the divergence theorem, Green's and Stokes' theorems. Intended for students in Honours Physics and Engineering Physics. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH101.title: MATH 101 Integral Calculus with Applications to Physical Sciences and Engineering
MATH101.info: The definite integral, integration techniques, applications, modeling, infinite series. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH100.title: MATH 100 Differential Calculus with Applications to Physical Sciences and Engineering
MATH100.info: Derivatives of elementary functions. Applications and modeling: graphing, optimization. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

PHYS101.title: PHYS 101 Energy and Waves
PHYS101.info: Fluids, harmonic oscillator, travelling waves, standing waves, sound, and interference of light waves, including diffraction. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414

PHYS102.title: PHYS 102 Electricity, Light and Radiation
PHYS102.info: Introduction to optics, electricity and magnetism, electric circuits, radioactivity, including biological applications. Please consult the Faculty of Science credit exclusion list: http://www.calendar.ubc.ca/vancouver/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414

CPSC110.title: CPSC 110 Computation, Programs, and Programming
CPSC110.info: Fundamental program and computation structures. Introductory programming skills. Computation as a tool for information processing, simulation and modeling, and interacting with the world.

PHYS100.title: PHYS 100 Introductory Physics
PHYS100.info: An introduction to fundamental concepts such as force, energy, momentum, and the use of graphs and vectors in physics; geometrical optics; electricity; laboratory exercises to familiarize the student with both the phenomena and the basic laboratory instruments commonly used to measure them. Students with credit for Physics 12 may not obtain credit for this course unless they took AP, IB, or A-level Physics and were offered advanced credit for PHYS 100.

MATH223.title: MATH 223 Linear Algebra
MATH223.info: Matrices, eigenvectors, diagonalization, orthogonality, linear systems, applications. Intended for Honours students. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH226.title: MATH 226 Advanced Calculus I
MATH226.info: Functions of several variables: limits, continuity, differentiability; implicit functions; Taylor's theorem; extrema; Lagrange multipliers; multiple integration, Fubini's theorem; improper integrals. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH253.title: MATH 253 Multivariable Calculus
MATH253.info: Partial and directional derivatives; maxima and minima; Lagrange multipliers and second derivative test; multiple integrals and applications. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH263.title: MATH 263 Multivariable and Vector Calculus
MATH263.info: Partial and directional derivatives, multiple integrals, divergence, gradient, curl, vector fields, potentials, line and surface integrals, theorems of Gauss, Green and Stokes. For students in Electrical and Computer Engineering. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

STAT203.title: STAT 203 Statistical Methods
STAT203.info: Organizing, displaying and summarizing data. Inference estimation and testing for elementary probability models. Not for credit towards a B.Sc. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section in the Calendar.)

STAT241.title: STAT 241 Introductory Probability and Statistics
STAT241.info: Probability models, random variables and vectors, estimation, testing, regression, analysis of variance, goodness of fit, quality control. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section of the Calendar).

STAT251.title: STAT 251 Elementary Statistics
STAT251.info: Probability, discrete and continuous random variables, joint probability distributions, estimation, hypothesis testing, regression, analysis of variance, goodness of fit. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section of the Calendar).

MATH302.title: MATH 302 Introduction to Probability
MATH302.info: Basic notions of probability, random variables, expectation and conditional expectation, limit theorems. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

STAT302.title: STAT 302 Introduction to Probability
STAT302.info: Basic notions of probability, random variables, expectation and conditional expectation, limit theorems. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section in the Calendar.)

MATH318.title: MATH 318 Probability with Physical Applications
MATH318.info: Random variables, discrete and continuous distributions. Random walk, Markov chains, Monte Carlo methods. Characteristic functions, limit laws. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

BIOL300.title: BIOL 300 Fundamentals of Biostatistics
BIOL300.info: Statistical procedures for biological research; estimation, hypothesis testing, goodness of fit, analysis of variance and regression; use of computers for statistical analysis. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion Lists: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH103.title: MATH 103 Integral Calculus with Applications to Life Sciences
MATH103.info: Antiderivatives and definite integrals, infinite series, applications to probability and dynamical systems. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH105.title: MATH 105 Integral Calculus with Applications to Commerce and Social Sciences
MATH105.info: Antiderivatives, the definite integral, techniques of integration, infinite series, partial derivatives, maxima and minima with constraints, discrete and continuous random variables. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH121.title: MATH 121 Honours Integral Calculus
MATH121.info: Definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, techniques and applications of integration, infinite series. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414

SCIE001.title: SCIE 001 Science One
SCIE001.info: An innovative first-year multidisciplinary course incorporating biology, chemistry, mathematics, and physics with a strong focus on the connections between these traditional disciplines. See the Science One website (www.scienceone.ubc.ca) for further information and the application process for admission to SCIE 001.

MATH111.title: MATH 111 Finite Mathematics
MATH111.info: Intended for students not majoring in Mathematics or the Sciences who want some exposure to mathematical thinking. Logic, set theory, combinatorics, probability theory, matrix algebra, linear programming, graphs, and networks. This course cannot be taken for credit towards a B.Sc. degree.

MATH102.title: MATH 102 Differential Calculus with Applications to Life Sciences
MATH102.info: Functions, derivatives, optimization, growth and decay, discrete probability. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH104.title: MATH 104 Differential Calculus with Applications to Commerce and Social Sciences
MATH104.info: Derivatives and rates of change, exponential and trigonometric functions, Newton's method, Taylor polynomials, maxima and minima, and graphing. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.calendar.ubc.ca/vancouver/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH110.title: MATH 110 Differential Calculus
MATH110.info: Topics as for MATH 100, but including relevant topics from algebra, geometry, functions, trigonometry, logarithms, and exponentials.

MATH120.title: MATH 120 Honours Differential Calculus
MATH120.info: Limits, derivatives, Mean Value Theorem and applications, elementary functions, optimization, Taylor series, approximation. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH180.title: MATH 180 Differential Calculus with Physical Applications
MATH180.info: Topics as for Math 100; intended for students with no previous knowledge of Calculus. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414. Not for credit for students with AP Calculus AB, AP Calculus BC, or a passing score on the UBC-SFU-UVIC-UNBC Calculus Challenge Examination.

MATH184.title: MATH 184 Differential Calculus for Social Science and Commerce
MATH184.info: Topics as for Math 104; intended for students with no previous knowledge of Calculus. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414. Not for credit for students with AP Calculus AB, AP Calculus BC, or a passing score on the UBC-SFU-UVIC-UNBC Calculus Challenge Examination.

CPSC121.title: CPSC 121 Models of Computation
CPSC121.info: Physical and mathematical structures of computation. Boolean algebra and combinations logic circuits; proof techniques; functions and sequential circuits; sets and relations; finite state machines; sequential instruction execution.

EECE210.title: EECE 210 Principles of Software Construction
EECE210.info: Design, implementation, reasoning about software systems: abstraction and specification of software, testing, verification, abstract data types, object-oriented design, type hierarchies, concurrent software design.

EECE309.title: EECE 309 Principles of Software Construction
EECE309.info: Design, implementation, reasoning about software systems: abstraction and specification of software, testing, verification, abstract data types, object-oriented design, type hierarchies, concurrent software design.

MATH215.title: MATH 215 Elementary Differential Equations I
MATH215.info: First-order equations; linear equations; linear systems; Laplace transforms; numerical methods; trajectory analysis of plane nonlinear systems. Applications of these topics will be emphasized. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH255.title: MATH 255 Ordinary Differential Equations
MATH255.info: Review of linear systems; nonlinear equations and applications; phase plane analysis; Laplace transforms; numerical methods. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

MATH256.title: MATH 256 Differential Equations
MATH256.info: Linear ordinary differential equations, Laplace transforms, Fourier series and separation of variables for linear partial differential equations. Tutorial session focuses on examples from chemical and biological engineering. Consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfmtree=12,215,410,414.

MATH265.title: MATH 265 Linear Differential Equations
MATH265.info: Linear ordinary differential equations. Complex numbers, Laplace transforms, frequency reponse, resonance, step response, systems. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.

BIOL121.title: BIOL 121 Genetics, Evolution and Ecology
BIOL121.info: Principles of storage and transmission of genetic variation; origin and evolution of species and their ecological interactions.

BIOL111.title: BIOL 111 Introduction to Modern Biology
BIOL111.info: Concepts fundamental to biological issues, such as the genetic basis of biological variation, evolution, infectious diseases, causes of cancer, population growth, and human effects on ecosystems. Not open to students who have credit for Biology 12 (including AP, IB).

HEBR101.title: HEBR 101 Elementary Biblical Hebrew Part I
HEBR101.info: Introduction to Biblical Hebrew grammar. Includes translation of prose and poetry from the Hebrew Bible.

HEBR102.title: HEBR 102 Elementary Biblical Hebrew Part II
HEBR102.info: A continuation of HEBR 101: Introduction to Biblical Hebrew grammar. Includes translation of prose and poetry from the Hebrew Bible.

HEBR201.title: HEBR 201 Intermediate Biblical Hebrew I
HEBR201.info: The second year of Biblical Hebrew with emphasis on rapid reading of poetry and prose along with grammar.

HEBR202.title: HEBR 202 Intermediate Biblical Hebrew II
HEBR202.info: The second year of Biblical Hebrew with emphasis on rapid reading of poetry and prose along with grammar.
